page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is predominantly flat with slight undulations, lying between 48 and 24 metres above sea-level. Being mainly arable farmland, the fields are mostly large and open with very few trees or hedges. Apart from a few solitary trees with preservation orders on them, what trees and hedges there are, are mainly around the houses and their enclosed meadows. There is one stretch of fenland adjoining the small river Ouse which supports some small trees as well as shrubs and some wildlife. This area of fen, which is a mixture of wet land and sandy soil is common land. Just in this block on the Northern edge stands Thelnetham windmill, an old post mill which has recently been renovated, and is now again grinding corn, using wind power.
